pages.title: About
pages.description: Ralph is a Chief Technology Officer as well as an Advisor at various (blockchain) startups. He solves complex challenges and provides solutions in Product Development, Software Architecture, Infrastructure, Automation and Security.

pages.description: I‚Äôve been very enthousiastic about the possibilities of Blockchain since 2010 (after reading the Bitcoin whitepaper). Now, in 2024, I‚Äôm a lot more skeptical about the usecases where it makes sense, but the concept absolutely has its usecases, of which the biggest is Bitcoin.

pages.title: Home
pages.content:
Welcome and thanks for visiting! I‚Äôm Ralph, a Chief Technology Officer from the Netherlands. I advise and manage startups with a strong, senior mentality and 25+ years of experience in bleeding-edge technology. 
For 20+ years I have worked in 40+ projects at corporate environments as a Senior Solution Architect in IT Service Management. For the last 14+ years I have worked on Startups as well, many of which in the Blockchain scene, as I have been involved with Bitcoin since 2010. 
In 2017 I was a founding (and core team-) member of Pillar, one of the first cryptocurrency ICOs, where we raised $27M in 60 hours. In 2018 I was a core team member of Jinbi, an ICO where we raised $47M over 6 months.
Currently I‚Äôm CTO of Apostille USA, a 100% automated platform for Apostille of Legal Documents; which reduces processing time from months to days. Created in March 2023, customers since 1st month, profitable since the 4th month, without external funding.

documents.title: iBitcoin
documents.content:
I started mining Bitcoin in 2010, and wanted to see my mining statistics on my phone whilst away.
We developed an app with Mining Stats, Market Data, Network Data and for a brief time wallet functionality 
via Exchange API calls. We were in Top 10 Finance apps for weeks until Apple removed our app from the AppStore.
Much of the functionality came from a personal need for information, steered by using it myself.

Up-to-date Prices

documents.title: Leesplankje
documents.content:
The concept was based on an old Dutch method for learning how to read, using a wooden board and blocks with letters.
We turned that into a digital version, using your fingers to drag letters. And when you touched a letter, you heard the proper pronounciation (in my Mom‚Äôs voice üòÅ).




Leesplankje for iPad Mockup (2010)

UI / UX Screenshots



The loading screen and first word (‚Äúzus‚Äù) - Leesplankje for iPad (2010)



Leesplankje for iPad - Complete the word by dragging letter pieces (2010)

Tutorial



Learn how to read with Leesplankje. Choose your difficulty (Easy, Medium, Hard) - Leesplankje for iPad (2010)



Rotate the iPad to see what the words should look like, turn sound on to hear the words - Leesplankje for iPad (2010)



Drag the letters to the empty placeholders. Tap the image to hear the word again. Leesplankje for iPad (2010)

AppStore Statistics



Day 1 of Sales - Leesplankje for iPhone & iPad (2010)



Leesplankje was #2 in the Top Educational Apps for iPhone (AppStore), and was acquired by Noordhoff (largest Dutch educational publisher).

documents.title: AstroWeather
documents.content:
Back in 2011, there were a number of weather apps for iPhone, but not many that were developed with Astronomers in mind.
This app has helped me many nights to estimate whether or not to go out with my telescope.
Born out of personal needs and a lack of options, AstroWeather lived for a few years on the AppStore.

documents.title: Ingress Bootcamp
documents.content:
I learned about the (then very unknown) Augmented Reality GPS game Ingress by Niantic Labs, through friends and learned its mechanics on the street. Since there were a lot of complex game mechanics to learn, I wrote a ‚Äúmissing manual‚Äù and it quickly became the defacto reading material for new players.

documents.title: Backlink Assassin
documents.content:
This project was an experiment to see how much one can detect and prove that certain domains are cheating Google PageRank by running Private Blog Networks (PBNs). It turned out quite successful, and over the course of about 6 months Google took down 100,000‚Äôs of backlinks to domains after they were exposed to be coming from PBNs with a 100% accuracy. 
The premise was simple: ‚ÄúIf a domain is useless, all of its outbound links to other domains are useless‚Äù. If you identify a domain with large numbers of backlinks to be a domain that no human would ever visit or find remotely interesting to spend time on, you likely found a PBN site. 
I traced inbound backlinks to powerful websites, and checked from what other domains their links were coming. Many of them were using dozens of domains with high Domain Authority that offered no useful information to a human, but insane amounts of backlinks for Google‚Äôs crawlers. 
This gave me an incredible insight into what powers the ‚Äúlink juice‚Äù for domains, and allowed me to see who is cheating (using backlinks from PBNs) and who isn‚Äôt (having organic backlinks). 
It also allowed me to report to Google, with high precision, what domains could be easily verified to be part of a PBN, and what backlinks should therefor be considered to solely exist for the purpose of ‚Äúmanipulating pagerank‚Äù. Once a domain is known to be part of a PBN, all of its outbound links are part as well.

Backlink Analysis Reports



An Domain Report containing a Backlink Analysis (sent to Google) on Pastebin - Header (2017)



Domain report - Target Summary (2017)



Domain report - Identified Paid Link resellers and IP-Addresses used by Target (2017)

documents.title: Wardial
documents.content:
Named after ‚ÄòWar dialing‚Äô from the 80s, this was a little Proof of Concept script to ‚Äòhack‚Äô Ethereum wallets by generating random wallet seeds and checking whether they have a balance. Basically ‚Äúdiscovering existing wallets‚Äù.
If a wallet with balance higher than 0 ETH was found, an alert would be sent through a Telegram bot.

It all started with my favorite book, written by Anthony Morris.

documents.title: The FARMacy
documents.content:
The Concept

  Local, affordable, healthy food for everyone


What if.. A store on a central location in the city could sell healthy farm products from outside the city, positively impacting local economy and health by minimizing supply-chains? All whilst freshness and produce history can be traced back to the farm, transparently, on the blockchain. Get fresh local food, and support your local farmers. We think this is possible, and we created a concept and prototype. Pitch Deck available on request.

Admin Dashboard
The Admin has the complete overview. Products are picked up in batches, delivered at stores, and all important timestamps are recorded on the blockchain. 


The FARMacy Prototype - Farmer‚Äôs Dashboard (2022)

Farmer's Dashboard
The farmer doesn‚Äôt have to do anything other than what he usually does. He has a fixed supply of products that will be picked according to an agreed upon schedule. If he wants, he can log in to the Farmer‚Äôs Dashboard to see historic activities and insights.


The FARMacy Prototype - Farmer‚Äôs Dashboard (2022)

Van Driver's Dashboard
The Van Drivers has a schedule of picking up products at farms, and dropping off products at store(s), according to an agreed upon schedule.


The FARMacy Prototype - Van Driver‚Äôs Dashboard (2022)

Van Driver's Tasks: Dropoff


The FARMacy Prototype - Van Driver‚Äôs Tasks: Dropoff (2022)

Van Driver's Tasks: Pickup


The FARMacy Prototype - Van Driver‚Äôs Tasks: Pickup (2022)

Van Driver arrived at Pickup Location


The FARMacy Prototype - Van Driver arrived at Pickup Location (2022)

Store Owner's Dashboard
The Store Owner can check the batches coming in, going out, review by customers, engagement with the community, etc. 


The FARMacy Prototype - Store Owner Dashboard (2022)

User's Dashboard
The user can see the history of their products (produced when / where, picked up when / where, etc) for all their products and grow a relationship with their local farmer. 


The FARMacy Prototype - User Dashboard (2022)

documents.title: Toxic Maxi
documents.content:
Bitcoin is the single, fully self-custodial asset in the world. Therefor it is important to know about it and understand how to use it. 
Bitcoin Lightning isn‚Äôt another coin, it is a complementary protocol based on the Bitcoin blockchain that works by using cryptographic side-chains to make transactions instant and near-free.
I started a company that helps individuals achieve self-custody over their Bitcoin, teach them about the use of bitcoin, and helps companies 
integrate Bitcoin (Lightning). The company has not launched yet, it is still a work in progress.




Launch Announcement - Home Page



Home Page



https://lightningnetwork.plus/posts/123



Products



Professional Services



Product Page



Product Page

documents.title: Apostille USA
documents.content:
An apostille is a crucial document that serves as proof of the authenticity of another document that has been signed by a notary public. This certification is required by international law, and it is issued by a government in accordance with the Hague Convention of 1961. The purpose of an apostille is to ensure that a document can be legally recognized and accepted in foreign countries.

In some cases, if the country of intended use does not participate in the Hague Convention, documents being sent to that country can still be authenticated or certified. This process can be time-consuming and complicated, and that‚Äôs why we developed a completely automated & integrated Document Apostille service, drastically removing bureacucracy and reducing processing times. Revolutionary in the industry.
All of the following aspects have been automated:

  Order process
  Payment process
  Shipping Label creation
  Fulfillment (physical apostille in all 50 U.S. states via local partners)
  Delivery
  Automatic fixing of 98% of exceptions







 Apostille USA: Place an Order in Less than a Minute! (2024)





 The Ultimate Guide to Apostille FBI Background Checks: Everything You Need to Know ! (2024)

documents.title: Instatunnel
documents.content:
Instatunnel was a concept around PrePaid VPN Bandwidth with zero logging. Each card gave a specific amount of guaranteed snoop-proof bandwidth. The prepaid cards were to be sold at Airports, Hotels, Supermarkets. After cleaning the scratch-code on the back, the code could be redeemed on an activation portal, after which the VPN would connect.




Prepaid Cards (2013)



Beta Portal (2013)



Status Page (2013)

documents.title: IT Service Management
documents.content:
For more than 20 years, I have worked at large international organisations as a Senior Solution Architect for IT Service Management software. My clients are usually based in Europe, North America and the Middle East. Banks, Insurance companies, Pharmaceutical companies, Petrochemical companies, usually organisations with a 100.000 employees or more.

My Resonsibilities:

  Stakeholder Meetings
  Consolidation and discovery of functional and technical requirements
  Advisory to the Board / Process Owners
  Design of technical solution
  User Interface design
  Implementation of solutions according to company policy and SDLC
  Infrastructure analysis and stress-tests
  Security analysis & penetration tests
  Administrator and End-User Documentation
  Business Reporting
  Automation & Integration
  Support and Training of employees / end-users


ITIL Processes:

  Service Management
  Incident Management
  Problem Management
  Change Management
  Release Management
  Request Management
  Asset Management
  Knowledge Management
  Configuration Management
  Service Level Management


Clients


    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
  




Peregrine ServiceCenter
I started in 1998 with Peregrine Systems ServiceCenter 3. The software was originally called PNMS (Problem Network Management System) for MVS / 3270 systems, and the GUI was based on ‚Äúlines‚Äù as to maintain backward compatibility with text-based UIs.



Peregrine Systems ServiceCenter v6 (2002)

HP ServiceManager
In 2005, HP acquired Peregrine Systems and made their various software products a part of the HP OpenView portfolio. ServiceCenter was then called ServiceManager, and it received a number of big updates that gave it less of a text-based GUI feeling.



HP ServiceManager v7 (2007)

ServiceNow
From around 2011, the ServiceNow platform (created by the former CTO of Peregrine Systems) had taken of a large share of the corporate IT Service Management market, and many corporations were making the switch.



ServiceNow (2015)

documents.title: Drones
documents.content:
I've been building Racing Drones since 2013, all with opensource software and hardware. Only since 2017 have I started using commercial consumer drones. So many beautiful places I have visited and flown FPV at ü•∞ 
  

I always dreamt of flying, and when building an FPV Drone became a realistic option, I jumped in and studied all I could, for 3 months. After that, I started building one drone after the other. Many of them FPV Racing Drones. These days I race less, but love Aerial Photography / Video. I‚Äôm still flying FPV in 2024.

documents.title: 3D Printing
documents.content:
In 2022 I started a project called Toxic Maxi, with the intention to educate people about Bitcoin and Bitcoin Lightning. In that context I started 3D Printing for the purpose of creating small cases for hardware-wallets, etc. A wonderful adventure that has taught me a great deal of things about manufacturing and design in 3D.



First 3D prints (2023)



Printing 24 whistles of 110dB (2023)



A pile of printed 110dB whistles (2023)



A steep learning curve. A lot of issues along the way. (2023)



And many lessons about fine details that could be printed better (2023)



And many ideas about things that could be better with the help of a little custom designed print. Such as this drying rack raiser (2023)



The Blockmit, an wonderful tool for making cheap but durable cold wallet, or backups of your seed phrase (2023)



The SeedSigner  (Orange Pill case), a low-cost, offline / Air-Gapped, transaction signer for Bitcoin (2023)

documents.title: iBitcoin
documents.content:
I started mining Bitcoin in 2010, and wanted to see my mining statistics on my phone whilst away.
We developed an app with Mining Stats, Market Data, Network Data and for a brief time wallet functionality 
via Exchange API calls. We were in Top 10 Finance apps for weeks until Apple removed our app from the AppStore.
Much of the functionality came from a personal need for information, steered by using it myself.

documents.title: Wardial
documents.content:
Named after ‚ÄòWar dialing‚Äô from the 80s, this was a little Proof of Concept script to ‚Äòhack‚Äô Ethereum wallets by generating random wallet seeds and checking whether they have a balance. Basically ‚Äúdiscovering existing wallets‚Äù.
If a wallet with balance higher than 0 ETH was found, an alert would be sent through a Telegram bot.

documents.title: The FARMacy
documents.content:
The Concept

  Local, affordable, healthy food for everyone


What if.. A store on a central location in the city could sell healthy farm products from outside the city, positively impacting local economy and health by minimizing supply-chains? All whilst freshness and produce history can be traced back to the farm, transparently, on the blockchain. Get fresh local food, and support your local farmers. We think this is possible, and we created a concept and prototype. Pitch Deck available on request.

Admin Dashboard
The Admin has the complete overview. Products are picked up in batches, delivered at stores, and all important timestamps are recorded on the blockchain. 


The FARMacy Prototype - Farmer‚Äôs Dashboard (2022)

Farmer's Dashboard
The farmer doesn‚Äôt have to do anything other than what he usually does. He has a fixed supply of products that will be picked according to an agreed upon schedule. If he wants, he can log in to the Farmer‚Äôs Dashboard to see historic activities and insights.


The FARMacy Prototype - Farmer‚Äôs Dashboard (2022)

Van Driver's Dashboard
The Van Drivers has a schedule of picking up products at farms, and dropping off products at store(s), according to an agreed upon schedule.


The FARMacy Prototype - Van Driver‚Äôs Dashboard (2022)

Van Driver's Tasks: Dropoff


The FARMacy Prototype - Van Driver‚Äôs Tasks: Dropoff (2022)

Van Driver's Tasks: Pickup


The FARMacy Prototype - Van Driver‚Äôs Tasks: Pickup (2022)

Van Driver arrived at Pickup Location


The FARMacy Prototype - Van Driver arrived at Pickup Location (2022)

Store Owner's Dashboard
The Store Owner can check the batches coming in, going out, review by customers, engagement with the community, etc. 


The FARMacy Prototype - Store Owner Dashboard (2022)

User's Dashboard
The user can see the history of their products (produced when / where, picked up when / where, etc) for all their products and grow a relationship with their local farmer. 


The FARMacy Prototype - User Dashboard (2022)

documents.title: Toxic Maxi
documents.content:
Bitcoin is the single, fully self-custodial asset in the world. Therefor it is important to know about it and understand how to use it. 
Bitcoin Lightning isn‚Äôt another coin, it is a complementary protocol based on the Bitcoin blockchain that works by using cryptographic side-chains to make transactions instant and near-free.
I started a company that helps individuals achieve self-custody over their Bitcoin, teach them about the use of bitcoin, and helps companies 
integrate Bitcoin (Lightning). The company has not launched yet, it is still a work in progress.




Launch Announcement - Home Page



Home Page



https://lightningnetwork.plus/posts/123

documents.title: iDomotics
documents.content:
Home Automation before it was cool. Controlled Lights, HVAC, Security, Cams, Coffee Machine.


Years before there were ready-to-use consumer solutions for automating your home, I developed an App to control my custom built Home Automation system.
The hardware was running the Z-Wave Protocol, the router and all appliances / switches / sensors. The software was developed on Xcode / iOS, and communicated with the Home Automation Router.

documents.title: Leesplankje
documents.content:
The concept was based on an old Dutch method for learning how to read, using a wooden board and blocks with letters.
We turned that into a digital version, using your fingers to drag letters. And when you touched a letter, you heard the proper pronounciation (in my Mom‚Äôs voice üòÅ).




Leesplankje for iPad Mockup (2010)

Drag the letters to the empty placeholders. Tap the image to hear the word again. Leesplankje for iPad (2010)

documents.title: Apostille USA
documents.content:
An apostille is a crucial document that serves as proof of the authenticity of another document that has been signed by a notary public. This certification is required by international law, and it is issued by a government in accordance with the Hague Convention of 1961. The purpose of an apostille is to ensure that a document can be legally recognized and accepted in foreign countries.

In some cases, if the country of intended use does not participate in the Hague Convention, documents being sent to that country can still be authenticated or certified. This process can be time-consuming and complicated, and that‚Äôs why we developed a completely automated & integrated Document Apostille service, drastically removing bureacucracy and reducing processing times. Revolutionary in the industry.
All of the following aspects have been automated:

  Order process
  Payment process
  Shipping Label creation
  Fulfillment (physical apostille in all 50 U.S. states via local partners)
  Delivery
  Automatic fixing of 98% of exceptions







 Apostille USA: Place an Order in Less than a Minute! (2024)





 The Ultimate Guide to Apostille FBI Background Checks: Everything You Need to Know ! (2024)
